descriptionSet.description: There are four different scenes of the movie depicted here. In the center, Amitabh Bachchan is standing with earnest mien. In the right upper corner, a dancing scene between Vinod Mehra and Tanjula, one of the main-actresses of the movie can be seen, while a conversation between Amitabh and Sanjeev Kumar takes place in the lower right corner. On the left, Amitabh, who plays the role of a taxi driver in this movie, is depicted while talking to some other taxi drivers and passersby. Parveen Babi is standing in front of the central figure of Amitabh and on Sanjeev Kumars´ left side.

inscription.text: Khud-Daar Cinemascope directed by Ravi Tandon
produced by F. K. Rattonsey Anwar Ali music Rajesh Roshan

description-en: There are four different scenes of the movie depicted here. In the center, Amitabh Bachchan is standing with earnest mien. In the right upper corner, a dancing scene between Vinod Mehra and Tanjula, one of the main-actresses of the movie can be seen, while a conversation between Amitabh and Sanjeev Kumar takes place in the lower right corner. On the left, Amitabh, who plays the role of a taxi driver in this movie, is depicted while talking to some other taxi drivers and passersby. Parveen Babi is standing in front of the central figure of Amitabh and on Sanjeev Kumars´ left side. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Hari R. Srivastav lives a middle-class life in rural India with two step-brothers, Govind and Rajesh. Circumstances compel him to get married to Seema, who dislikes Govind and Rajesh. When Hari goes to Bombay to study law to become a lawyer, she manages to get rid of the two children, who find their way to Bombay, become beggars, then are rescued by a devout Muslim, Rahim, who looks after them like his own children, Farida and Anwar. 20 years later, Hari, Govind and Rajesh are re-united in a Courtroom - where Hari is the Judge; Rajesh is accused of embezzling money from his father-in-law, Verma, and of drug-dealing and smuggling; while Govind, a taxi-driver, prone to physical violence - is accused of killing Verma!!! (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: The poster is characterized by a somewhat visual density. The film is about the lives of three estranged brothers and Amitabh Bachchan plays the role of a taxi driver. The extensive detailing here makes the posters look cluttered and is typical of many posters of the 1970s and 1980s. Too many actors are present here making it difficult to locate the thematic arc of the film. The posters lack character, cluttered with details but conveying very little. (Ranjani Mazumdar) (gs)
